alert.note: Alert for McIntosh (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 27 at 10:07PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Georgia, including the following county, McIntosh. * WHEN...Until 1100 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1003 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - A USGS rain gauge near Meridian and a NERRS rain gauge on Sapelo Island have both measured nearly 4 inches of rain this evening. Another round of moderate to occasionally heavy rainfall will pass through the southern portion of McIntosh County over the next hour and could produce another half of an inch to an inch before ending. Any ongoing roadway flooding will continue through the late evening hours. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Darien, Ridgeville, Carnigan, Meridian, Wolf Island, Valona, Sapelo Island, Little Saint Simons Island, Blackbeard Island, Ashintilly, Ardick and Raccoon Bluff.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Report flooding directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 1-888-383-2024 or email your reports to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.
